moves.5. Bxf7+: Nxf7 offers Black a strong attack and at least equality, even better in many lines. This move, Bf7+, requires precise play by Black.
moves.8. Qb3+: ?? Ng5! wins because of the double threat of f7++ and d5++.
moves.8... d5 9. Nbc3 Be6 10. O-O: ? White does not realize that Black has serious threats.
moves.15. Rb1 Bc4 16. d3: White wants to get some pieces out.
moves.16... Qxd3 17. Be3: White sacrifices a piece but better was Ng3.
moves.17... Nxe3 18. fxe3 Qxe4 19. Qxc7: White hopes that Black will overlook the threats on the a2-g8 diagonal.
moves.20. Rxf8+: White hopes for a perpetutal check.
The Q checks have ended, mate follows.
